pull.title: random: scope environ extern to macOS, BSDs and Illumos
pull.body:
These platforms fail to compile with it removed.
macOS: #33675
BSDs / Illumos: https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin-core-nightly/pull/79.

events.body:
> Testing on some other platforms: [hebasto/bitcoin-core-nightly#79](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin-core-nightly/pull/79).

Builds on the *BSD and illumos systems failed.

rename.from: random: scope the environ extern to macOS
rename.to: random: scope environ extern to macOS, BSDs and Illumos

random: scope environ extern to macOS, BSDs and Illumos

These platforms fail to compile with it removed.

events.message:
random: scope environ extern to macOS, BSDs and Illumos

These platforms fail to compile with it removed.

events.body:
ACK 79d6f458e2300e1f47b94467cda233e1c761f8be

Thanks @hebasto for checking the other platforms.

comments.body:
If it's only needed on Mac, wouldn't:
```suggestion
#ifdef __APPLE__
```
be better here?
I'm not 100% sure that is the only place it's needed, however this has historically been unclear, and the only platform I'm aware of that definitely needs it, is macOS.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,8 +57,12 @@
 #include <sys/auxv.h>
 #endif
 
-#ifndef WIN32
-extern char** environ; // NOLINT(readability-redundant-declaration): Necessary on some platforms
comments.body:
nit: I think the comment can be kept as-is, or just refer to "Necessary on the above platforms". Otherwise, it is just one more line to maintain.

Also, I wonder if this can just be checked at configure-time, but no strong opinion.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,8 +57,12 @@
 #include <sys/auxv.h>
 #endif
 
-#ifndef WIN32
-extern char** environ; // NOLINT(readability-redundant-declaration): Necessary on some platforms
comments.body: Re-modified the comment. Not sure there is too much value in moving this to configure.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,8 +57,12 @@
 #include <sys/auxv.h>
 #endif
 
-#ifndef WIN32
-extern char** environ; // NOLINT(readability-redundant-declaration): Necessary on some platforms
comments.body: Actually, the `NOLINT` was fixed and can be removed? You've confirmed that it is undeclared on the listed platforms, so it can't be hit by `readability-redundant-declaration`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,8 +57,12 @@

 #endif
 
-#ifndef WIN32
-extern char** environ; // NOLINT(readability-redundant-declaration): Necessary on some platforms
